# https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lRypYtmbKMs

To move into high-level automation, you need a Reusable Workflow. This allows you to define the "Golden Standard" for Docker publishing once and call it from any other repository or pipeline.

By using workflow_call, we can strictly define required inputs (like image name) and secrets (like credentials) so the calling pipeline doesn't have to worry about the implementation details.
The Reusable Publisher (.github/workflows/docker-publish.yml)


name: Reusable Docker Publisher

on:
  workflow_call:
    inputs:
      image_name:
        required: true
        type: string
        description: "The name of the image (e.g., my-app)"
      tag:
        required: false
        type: string
        default: latest
        description: "The version tag"
      dockerfile_path:
        required: false
        type: string
        default: ./Dockerfile
    secrets:
      registry_username:
        required: true
      registry_password:
        required: true

jobs:
  publish:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout Code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up QEMU
        uses: docker/setup-qemu-action@v3
        description: "Enables multi-platform builds (arm64/amd64)"

      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

      - name: Login to Registry
        uses: docker/login-action@v3
        with:
          username: ${{ secrets.registry_username }}
          password: ${{ secrets.registry_password }}

      - name: Build and Push
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v6
        with:
          context: .
          file: ${{ inputs.dockerfile_path }}
          push: true
          tags: |
            ${{ secrets.registry_username }}/${{ inputs.image_name }}:${{ inputs.tag }}
            ${{ secrets.registry_username }}/${{ inputs.image_name }}:sha-${{ github.sha }}
          # Multi-platform support for production scale
          platforms: linux/amd64,linux/arm64 
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max



How to use it in your Main Pipeline
Now, your ci-pipeline.yml stays clean. It simply "calls" the publisher.

jobs:
  call-docker-publish:
    uses: ./.github/workflows/docker-publish.yml
    with:
      image_name: "html_nginx_2"
      tag: "v2.0.4"
    secrets:
      registry_username: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}
      registry_password: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}
